solution_line_template: At the second store, she tried on {shoes_store1}+{more_than_store1}=<<{shoes_store1}+{more_than_store1}={shoes_store2}>>{shoes_store2} pairs of shoes.

Therefore, at the first three stores, she tried on {shoes_store1}+{shoes_store2}+{shoes_store3}=<<{shoes_store1}+{shoes_store2}+{shoes_store3}={shoes_first_three_stores}>>{shoes_first_three_stores} pairs of shoes.
At the fourth store, she tried on {shoes_first_three_stores}*{multiplier_twice}=<<{shoes_first_three_stores}*{multiplier_twice}={shoes_store4}>>{shoes_store4} pairs of shoes.
Thus, in total, she tried on {shoes_first_three_stores}+{shoes_store4}=<<{shoes_first_three_stores}+{shoes_store4}={total_shoes_tried_on}>>{total_shoes_tried_on} pairs of shoes.
